required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Phase ll Study of HEC585 in Patients With IPF
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase II, Multi-center, Randomized, Placebo-controlled (Double-blind Design), Active Comparator-controlled (Open-label Design), Parallel-group, Dose-finding Study, to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of HEC585 Tablets in Patients With IPF

brief_summary.textblock: A Phase ll Study to evaluate the efficacy and safety of various doses of HEC585 Tablets in patients with idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline to Week 24 in %FVC compared with placebo
primary_outcome.description: change in %FVC, measured using Spirometer, from baseline to week 24

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline to Week 24 in %FVC compared with Pirfenidone
secondary_outcome.description: change in %FVC, measured using Spirometer, from baseline to week 24

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline to Week 12 in %FVC compared with placebo/ Pirfenidone
secondary_outcome.description: change in %FVC, measured using Spirometer, from baseline to week 12

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects with an absolute decline from baseline in FVC (% predicted) of > 10%
secondary_outcome.description: The proportion of subjects whose %FVC decline from baseline by more than 10% in each treatment group at W24

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to first acute IPF exacerbation

arm_group.description: Drug: HEC585 dose A once daily, up to 24 weeks
Drug: HEC585 dose B once daily, up to 24 weeks
Drug: HEC585 dose C once daily, up to 24 weeks
Drug: pirfenidone three times a day (target dose), up to 24 weeks
Drug: placebo once daily, up to 24 weeks
